title: What are some examples of good catch phrases to write in an essay? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Catch phrases” are the same as cliches, so don't use them. There is no such thing as a “good” catch phrase in quality writing. However… You may actually be asking about writing a good “hook” for your essay, meaning you want to “catch” the reader’s attention. If so, there are a number of literary devices you can use for that first line. Take these examples I made up that could be used for an essay on the minimum wage: Ask a question that sets up the background and thesis statement in your first paragraph. (“Will raising the minimum wage to $15 an hour really make a dent in ending the cycle of poverty?”)Use a “visual” sentence that describes a situation, much like the opening to a fiction story. “Every morning, 6 days a week, Jane Doe rises at 5 a.m. To prepare her family’s day before taking the 6:15 crosstown bus to her minimum-wage job at the Acme Hotel.”)Set up the unexpected, a sentence that leads the reader to believe something is the norm (or not the norm), with a thesis that will show the opposite. “Few neighbors knew that John Doe, who worked a job at minimum wage for 30 years, was actually a millionaire.”Start with a relevant quote: “My father worked at minimum wage for 30 years,” said Mary Doe, “but he squirreled away everything he could to help me get to college, even skipping meals just to save that dollar or two, long before I was born.”Here is a link to college admission essays that were successful. Read them and analyze what made them good to help you write your own better. We improve our writing through both practice and through good reading — caring about our topics and our readers — not through any special tricks or forced cleverness. College Essays - Top 150 Essays That Worked Happy and thoughtful writing to you!

Use more idioms which relates to a particular situation such as:Hold your horses (meaning:be patient),Get down to brass tacks (meaning:to become serious about something),Go out on a limb (meaning:to put yourself in a tough position in order to support someone).If u want more,you can ask me!
